definition: to make sb change their ways, opinions etc
to turn/to twist/to wring/to sprain/to swing one's hips
to be difficult with sb/to provoke disagreement/at loggerheads/to fall out with

sentences.english: Being different, sometimes awkwardly so, comes naturally to Newfoundlanders.
sentences.chinese: 與衆不同，有時很彆扭，紐芬蘭人。

sentences.english: The thinking is to incite violence against whom the sum?
sentences.chinese: 二思慫恿暴力是要跟誰鬧彆扭？

sentences.english: The movements feel so weird and unnatural. Is this normal?
sentences.chinese: 動作感覺很彆扭不自然，這正常嗎？

sentences.english: The spot at the southwest corner of the house,however, was never going to look nice.
sentences.chinese: 然而，房屋西南角的那一塊地方總是讓人看着彆扭。

sentences.english: She grew cross and wearisome, snapping at and teasing Catherine continually.
sentences.chinese: 她變得彆扭而且消沉，常常叱罵和戲弄凱瑟琳。

sentences.english: I feel uncomfortable during interviews because I need to talk about myself.
sentences.chinese: 在訪談中要聊自己，所以感覺很彆扭。

sentences.english: But he was rough and harsh-spoken and difficult when he was drinking.
sentences.chinese: 可是他一喝了酒，就態度粗暴，出口傷人，性子彆扭。

sentences.english: "Sometimes we seem to make life complicated for ourselves, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “有時候我們似乎自己給自己找彆扭，”他說。

sentences.english: They seemed to delight in making people uncomfortable.
sentences.chinese: 他們好像樂於讓給人找彆扭。

sentences.english: Google started its feud with the Chinese government in March.
sentences.chinese: 而3月，谷歌就和中國政府鬧彆扭。

sentences.english: It’s an apprehensive stance that will make others around you feel uncomfortable as well.
sentences.chinese: 這種讓人難受的姿勢也會讓周圍的人感到彆扭。

sentences.english: I absolutely understand your feeling. Because it's inevitable to quarrel with your best friend.
sentences.chinese: 跟好友鬧彆扭，常比與情人鬥氣，更來得火大。

sentences.english: Does that strike you as nannyish and make you a little queasy?
sentences.chinese: 這樣做會不會小題大做，讓你感覺有點兒彆扭？

sentences.english: When you stood in front of me, suddenly, I felt wird.
sentences.chinese: 他站在我面前的那時候，我忽然覺得彆扭。

sentences.english: The novel does contain some awkward phrasing.
sentences.chinese: 小說裏也出現了一些彆扭的措詞。

sentences.english: We all know that asking people for money can be daunting.
sentences.chinese: 我們都知道向別人伸手要錢是很彆扭的。

definition: unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
to get the desired outcome/to win favor by fawning on sb/to curry favor with/a fruitful outcome to reward one's labor
lacking in confidence/diffident/to have a guilty conscience
now hot, now cold/(of one's mood, affection etc) to alternate
